content: bobble granny heart this is a small heart with a circular center popcorn stitches give it a raised texture if worked up in cotton it would make a cute trivet for a teapot sew two together for a small decorative pillowcase stitch onto a sweater as an appliqué i prefer using dk to worsted weight yarn to get the best texture for the popcorn stitches a thinner yarn will yield flatter popcorns a bulkier yarn will yield puffier popcorns supplies any yarn of your choice for example k & c essential 100% cotton which was used for the samples crochet hook of your choice i used size g or 4 25 mm scissors tapestry needle for weaving in ends gauge the required gauge is not precise using k & c essential 100% cotton and a size g hook i achieved a final size of approximately 7 in by 7 in approximately 18 cm by 18 cm i recommend going up a hook size if your gauge tends to be tighter especially if you are using a yarn that is not stretchy abbreviations chain = chain st = stitch sl = slip single_crochet = single_crochet half_double_crochet = half_double_crochet double_crochet = double_crochet treble_crochet = treble_crochet popcorn = popcorn beginning create a magic loop or create a ring made up of 3-5 chains row 1 chain 3 counts as first double_crochet 11 double_crochet into the magic loop or the loop created by the chains sl st into the first double_crochet the chain 3 made at the beginning if using a magic loop pull the magic loop tight there should be 12 dcs including the chain 3 at the beginning of the row row 2 chain 4 counts as first double_crochet and chain 1 double_crochet into the same first st double_crochet into the next st ch1 double_crochet into the same st eleven times slip_stitch into the first chain 3 making sure to leave a chain 1 space there should be a total of 24 dcs including the first chain 3 row 3 slip_stitch into the ch1 space start a popcorn by creating a chain 3 4 double_crochet into the same chain 1 space keep the loop created from finishing the last double_crochet very loose and open remove the hook from this loop and insert it into the first double_crochet in this case a chain 3 then insert the hook into the loose loop pull this loop through the first double_crochet chain 3 *create another popcorn in the same manner into the next chain 1 space except create 5 double_crochet instead of a chain 3 and 4 dcs chain 3 repeat from * 10 more times for 12 popcorn total slip_stitch into the first popcorn that you created there should be 12 pcs row 4 slip_stitch into the next chain 3 space chain 4 2 treble_crochet into the same chain 3 space chain 2 then 3 treble_crochet into the same chain 3 space chain 1 3 double_crochet into the next chain 3 space twice chain
